thread.title: Wolf Creek TV adaptation under way with John Jarratt, Lucy Fry and Deborah Mailman
thread.title_full: Wolf Creek TV adaptation under way with John Jarratt, Lucy Fry and Deborah Mailman

author: Sarah Thomas
title: Wolf Creek TV adaptation under way with John Jarratt, Lucy Fry and Deborah Mailman
text:
Lucy Fry stars in the TV adaptation of Wolf Creek. 
Stan developing local dramas Shooting on the Wolf Creek television spin-off gets under way in South Australia this week with Australian actor Lucy Fry to battle John Jarratt's chilling outback killer Mick Taylor. 
The six-part drama series, commissioned by streaming service Stan which is co-owned by Fairfax Media, will feature Fry as 19-year-old Eve, who survives a massacre at the hands of Taylor and embarks on revenge. 
John Jarratt will reprise his role as outback serial killer Mick Taylor. 
Greg McLean, the writer-director behind the acclaimed Wolf Creek (2005) and its 2013 sequel,  Wolf Creek 2 , is helming the TV series, which will air mid-2016. 
Advertisement Fry, who has another upcoming role alongside James Franco in the TV adaptation of Stephen King's 11/22/63 , is also signed up for McLean's supernatural feature, 6 Miranda Drive , with Kevin Bacon and Radha Mitchell, out next year. 
Wolf Creek will also feature other local talent including Deborah Mailman, Miranda Tapsell, Dustin Clare and Jessica Tovey. 
The original feature sparked controversy because of its extreme violence. Despite mixed reviews, it reaped almost $US28 million at the global box office.
Margaret Pomeranzâ€‹ and David Stratton famously declined to review the sequel on At the Movies .
McLean responded at the time: "Even if they didn't enjoy the movie, there are many, many Wolf Creek fans out there who love horror and thriller movies and want to support locally made productions."
